body.text:
W hen children have difficult experiences it can be hard to know how to help. In the webinar, Dr Naomi Fisher will explain how trauma affects the brain, why it can be hard to recover and how parents can help their children. You'll leave with an understanding of what's going on for your child (and you) and some practical ideas for how to help. This webinar is suitable for those who have experienced different types of trauma, including medical trauma, family loss and school trauma.

Dr Naomi Fisher is a clinical psychologist who specialises in working with trauma. She is registered with the HCPC. This webinar is not therapy and should not be used as a substitute for therapy.

Participants in previous webinars have said.

Naomi's insight into children needs to be shared far and wide. That she can not only help children and families but also break down the information into easily digested bitesize nuggets illustrates her phenomenal level of understanding and skill.

Thank you so much. This was extremely helpful and validating. No one listens and no one understands. It is very isolating.

Your webinar was hugely reassuring and managed to provide clarity on the complex, unfathomable, frustrating times we have had as a family. It sounds a massive cliche but I felt someone finally understood what our life has been like. You showed great empathy with children and families struggling with this baffling and painful situation, coming from a place of experience.

I really appreciated your messages of hope- this is a journey and we will come out the end.

Naomi's website: www.naomifisher.co.uk and Substack naomicfisher.substack.com

The webinar is recorded and will be available for two weeks afterward if you choose the Recorded option at checkout.


Refund policy: We cannot process refunds in the last 48 hours before an event. Before that we will process the refund but Eventbrite fees will be deducted.


Cover illustration: Becky Whinnerah @BexGoneWest

iPhone users note there is a problem buying tickets with the Eventbrite iPhone app. Please use a web browser such as Chrome or Safari instead.

Are you a parent navigating the complexities of the Special Educational Needs (SEN) Tribunal process? Join Dr Abigail Fisher for a webinar designed specifically to guide parents through this challenging journey, and to help in weathering the stormy seas. Whether you're new to the process or seeking to deepen your understanding, this session will equip you with the knowledge and confidence you need to advocate effectively for your child's educational needs.


Key Topics


  • Understanding the SEN Tribunal Process: An overview of the tribunal system, its purpose, and what to expect.
  • Preparation Tips: Hear from other parents about how they prepared for their hearing.
  • Legal Framework: Help you orient yourself with the key legislation and legal language.
  • Communication: Strategies for communicating with schools, local authorities, and tribunal officials.
  • Common Challenges: Tips on navigating typical obstacles parents face during the tribunal process.


Dr Abigail Fisher is an educational psychologist who has worked in local authorities and now works independently. She has special interests in helping parents navigate complex and confusing SEN processes, through providing clear, easy to digest information, and supporting parents to look after themselves so they can better care for their families.

Feedback from earlier webinars

Your knowledge is so refreshing. Thankyou for raising the profile of the education system and its impact.

This was very helpful and thought provoking.

It was very validating.

faqs.answer: This webinar is hosted on Zoom. Please make sure you have Zoom installed before the event, and test the audio to make sure it's working. Eventbrite will send out a reminder 2 hours before the event and 10 minutes before the event you will be emailed the webinar link.

faqs.answer: Yes, if you choose the webinar + recording option you can watch it in your own time
faqs.question: Can I miss the webinar and watch it later?

faqs.answer: We'll send a link by the morning after the webinar
faqs.question: When will I be sent a link to the recording?

faqs.answer: You can watch the recording for 30 days after the webinar
faqs.question: How long can I watch the recording for?

body.text:
iPhone users note there is a problem buying tickets with the Eventbrite iPhone app. Please use a web browser such as Chrome or Safari instead.

Many children with learning disabilities are anxious - but those around them might not recognise this as anxiety. They're unlikely to say 'I'm worried' but instead will show us their feelings through their behaviour. Behaviour which can be hard to manage.

How can parents recognise anxiety in their children, and what do you do then?

In this webinar, Naomi Fisher, clinical psychologist, will explain how anxiety works and why it can be a problem for children with learning disabiltiies. She'll give you practical ideas to reduce anxiety and help your children thrive.

This webinar is suitable for parents of children with learning disabilities or global developmental delay.


It will cover:

Learning disabilities and child development

Anxiety

Why anxiety can be a problem for those with learning disabilties.

What parents can do to help.


Dr Naomi Fisher is a clinical psychologist and author. She specialises in trauma, autism and alternative appraoches to education. She has worked with both adults and children with learning disabilities.

She is registered with the HCPC. This webinar is not therapy and should not be used as a replacement for therapy.

Feedback from earlier webinars

Your webinar was hugely reassuring and managed to provide clarity on the complex, unfathomable , frustrating times we have had as a family. It sounds a massive cliche but I felt someone finally understood what our life has been like. You showed great empathy with children and families struggling with this baffling and painful situation, coming from a place of experience.

I really appreciated your messages of hope.

After your webinar we are more able to support our daughter, speak to her special setting confidently & already supported better decision making with her needs at the centre.
